description.narrative: By 2022, caregivers of children under 5 years continue to accept and demand polio vaccination and have access to quality vaccines that will contribute to polio eradication., which contributes to Immunization. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most at-risk newborns and children are benefiting from integrated newborn, child health interventions and healthy behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, caregivers of children under 5 years continue to accept and demand polio vaccination and have access to quality vaccines that will contribute to polio eradication.

description.narrative: Pakistan polio programme conducted 20 campaigns during 2019, targeting nearly 39 million children during national immunization days. UNICEF supported procurement of 206 million doses of vaccines, ensuring 100 per cent availability. With 128 cases of WPV1 reported (a dramatic increase from 12 in 2018), only 10 were reported from core reservoirs where a UNICEF-supported CBV programme is implemented. The increase in cases and positive environmental samples indicates that, despite multiple campaigns and sustained efforts, the programme did not reach the quality and coverage to stop poliovirus transmission. Reviews conducted suggested greater focus on enhancing communication approaches, a UNICEF focus area | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Planned supplemental implementation activities that were cancelled, postponed or reduced in size, during the previous 6 months due to gaps in vaccine supply
Children under 5 years missing polio vaccination due to refusal (Target: <1%)

Number and percentage of children missed OPV due to Non-Availability at tier 1, 2 & 3 districts
Number and percentage of missed children at tier 1,2 & 3 districts
Availability of stocks of polio vaccine (IPV and bOPV) at national and subnational level for use in routine immunisation programmes for at least 6 months
